I'm relieved. With your help, we were able to evacuate the passengers, at least.
The repairmen—the real repairmen—are still trapped inside the $map:52010009$.
I'm certain there are monsters in there with them... While I want the rails repaired, their safety is more important.
Please go into the $map:52010009$ and make sure my workers are okay.
Please go into the $map:52010009$ and make sure my workers are okay.
The last of the repairmen just made it out. They're being checked for injuries now.
Thanks to you, nobody was seriously hurt. I don't know if I can ever thank you enough.
I was on my home to my blessed hometown, and the train stopped... And th-then... And then!!
Take a deep breath and speak slowly.
I thought they were workers coming to help me with my bags... but they were monsters in disguise! They took all my things!
I've been busy lately, and I haven't had time to keep up with my parents back home. I was going to make it up to them with piles and piles of gifts, but now they're all gone...
R-really? You'll get my gifts back? While you're at it, teach those nasty $npcNamePlural:21000735$ and $npcNamePlural:21000732$ for stealing my precious presents!
I'd rather not go home at all if I can't get my stuff back. Please get the gifts back from the $npcNamePlural:21000735$ and $npcNamePlural:21000732$.
Th-thank you! Thank you so much! Sniff...
Bravo! Bravo! This is it! I've hit the jackpot!
Hey, come closer and I'll let you in on this once-in-a-lifetime opportunity!
I'm here to record the upcoming fight. But the thing is, there's not much money in these kinds of shows anymore. People want something fresh.
Something like... the monsters completely destroying the arena here! I already have a name in mind. "Arena Attack! A Special Seven Day Miniseries."
It doesn't get more real than this! We'll get ratings to die for. I promise you that.
We've got to hurry up or this opportunity will pass us by. Get the $itemPlural:30000482$ from the cameras around $map:02010020$. Quickly!
Collect the $itemPlural:30000482$ from the cameras around $map:02010020$. Hurry!
Now I possess all the tapes! Thanks. It's time for my star to rise at last...
This makes absolutely no sense! My calculations were perfect. I analyzed the last twenty bouts of both fighters. There's no way my prediction could have been wrong.
This match should have gone to $npcName:11001378[gender:0]$, no question. There must be something else going on here...
I hope you're not brushing me off. My calculations are never wrong! Somebody must have manipulated the data...
Let me think... The original copies of the data should be in the $map:52010010$. I'm sure of it.
The solution is simple, then. All you need to do is sneak into the $map:52010010$ and bring me the $item:30000483$.
You will do it, of course. I'm an extremely popular manager. People will notice if I go myself.
All you need to do is sneak into the $map:52010010$ and bring me the $item:30000483$.
And I was right, of course. The $item:30000483$ were in the office. I'd better hurry up and check out this data...
It's not too late. We have just enough time to prepare a defense... but...
You're right. $npcName:11000069[gender:1]$ will get reinforcements from the $map:02000146$, but I don't know if we can hold out that long.
He's working with the $npcName:11001811[gender:0]$... but he's trying to save the world? Nothing makes sense...
This isn't the time to second guess each other.
You're right. We can worry about that after we survive this fight. Ready to go?
Are you all right, Your Majesty?
Th-this... This is what Cerian meant... Destruction from light...
He said... that this is how the world would end...
Your Imperial Highness, you swore never to speak of this in public! We must be... cautious... in these trying times.
Karl, if this continues, then I might really...
Please escort her to safety. Immediately!
Minister, why don't you tell us all about this destructive light?
After everything they've been through, surely they have a right to know.
Nobody has a right to know anything. I will say, however, that I've heard some disturbing things about you and our enemies.
I would much rather know how you knew of this invasion when even my most elite scouts were caught unawares.
Surely the daughter of the great Winn Stilton isn't colluding with the enemy? He would be turning in his grave.
Captain, arrest this woman. We cannot allow her to walk free until we're certain of her loyalties.
Maybe you forgot, but without $npcName:11000069[gender:1]$'s warning, this city wouldn't be standing!
Captain, while you're at it, arrest $npcName:11000064[gender:0]$, as well. I'd like to find out exactly what he was up to—and what alliances he formed—while he was busy hiding from the law.
You just got Dark Wind back on your side. You really want to make an enemy of us so quick?
Look outside! While you're in here bickering, our guards lie in the street, injured from the battle for their homeland.
Is this really the time for your petty infighting?
$npcName:11001966[gender:0]$ is right. Our city needs us.
Oh jeez... This doesn't look good, does it?
I'm... I'm fine, you guys. Help the other guards...
I just need to... be still for a bit...
$MyPCName$, did we... did we save Tria?
Yes. Everyone's safe, thanks to you.
You're the best hero I know.
Th-thank you... I'll... I hope we meet again...
I was just looking for you. Please, go inside... and good luck!
I don't think I ever introduced myself. I'm Sir Rowen of the Secret Knights. I heard you had quite an adventure up north recently.
Ah, maybe this isn't the best time. Please head into the command center. Everyone is waiting for you.
The master wizard, $npcName:11000042[gender:1]$, says that she knows how to track lumarigon magic—and, along with it, Madria's stronghold.
That's right. The very Lumenstone that you recovered.
Captain Allon says that you'll play a central role in the next mission, too.
You'd better not keep the others waiting. Good luck!
As I'm sure you're all aware, we've been working to gather information on the enemy from many different angles.
We have worked tirelessly to this end. We've been so busy that we haven't even had time to introduce you all to each other.

However, for all this, we still haven't had the opportunity to launch a counterattack. We've had some minor skirmishes here and there, but we don't even know where or how the shadows are keeping their forces.
In other words, we're completely and utterly clueless.
But I think that's all about to change, thanks to the esteemed wizard, $npcName:11000042[gender:1]$.
Ah... So her spell is complete?
Yes. After grueling hours of studying the Lumenstone we retrieved from Karkar Island, $npcName:11000042[gender:1]$ has developed a spell to trace lumarigon.
We've had reason to believe that Madria's dragon is somehow related to the lumarigon. With this spell, we now have the key to tracking her down.
We need our best if we're going to track Madria's dragon... and her fortress. That means you, $MyPCName$.
This won't be easy, but you're our best hope. I'm afraid the alliance doesn't have the soldiers to spare to back you up.
I'll find a way to get this done.
That's what I like about you. Never even an ounce of hesitation. You'll be accompanied by $npcName:11000042[gender:1]$, as she's the only one who knows how to use her spell.
Speaking of $npcName:11000042[gender:1]$, she should be here by now...
It must have been a long journey, $npcName:11000042[gender:1]$.
Yes, very! Teleporting over long distances is exhausting. But it seems like I missed all the important stuff.
I've only just brought the others up to speed on your brilliant research.
So you haven't gotten to the important stuff! If you'll just allow me, I'd love to bring everyone up to speed on the unlimited potential of lumarigon-derived mana matrices.

Imagine if you will a series of parallel mana constructs arrayed into a series of ever-winding strings that cascade into each other resulting in geometrically increasing magical output that is reflected not only in their advanced spellwork but also their culture which may I say far eclipses those of humans by—

E-enough! I mean... This is all written down in your report, master wizard. I'll see to it that the others are informed of your discoveries so that you don't have to... ahem... waste your valuable time explaining it to us.
You have my word as a knight.
That would be efficient, yes. To put it bluntly, my own magic is like that of a child compared to the lumarigon.
But, if my meager spell is of use to the alliance, then it makes me one very happy dragon fan.
Let's go over the plan, shall we! $npcName:11000042[gender:1]$ and $MyPCName$ will go on a scouting mission to track down Madria's dragon.
Remember, your focus is on information gathering. If you find Madria's stronghold, fall back until the rest of the alliance can join you.
Excuse me. I must have misheard. You're sending me on this mission?
You created the spell, did you not? Besides, according to your report, the magic you're tracing is very faint. I don't think we can risk a lesser mage losing the trail.
No, no no no. This is certainly the job for one of the alliance's mages, don't you think? I am not trained for battle!
I won't do it. I simply won't do it!
This is a difficult situation. This spell is too complex for any of our own mages. Without $npcName:11000042[gender:1]$'s help...
Empress, there's no other choice. We have to resort to... that strategy.
I trust your judgment in this, but are you sure we can even obtain it...?
With the right combination of prayer and divine intervention... perhaps.
$npcName:11000042[gender:1]$, I would like to offer you a gift upon completion of this mission.
It's a 10th anniversary limited edition from Nerman Toys. Mint condition. "Afrien the Onyx Dragon."
She wasn't lying. She really is a fan...
There's no time to waste, $MyPCName$! Maple World is counting on us!
My spell found a concentration of lumarigon magic at $map:52000088$. Meet me there!
My spell found a concentration of lumarigon magic at $map:52000088$. Meet me there!
It's about time you got here. I came as fast as I could. You have no idea how much I need that figur—I mean, world peace!
Anyway, look over there. See the hot springs that formed in the middle of the ice?
Most people aren't used to seeing such extremes right next to each other. Dragons, on the other hand, love places like this.
But that's all basic stuff. Any dragon could have come here. We need to prove that it was the right dragon.
Look at those rocks. There's lumarigon magic coming from their runes.
Rune stones are used to cast powerful spells while only using a little bit of spirit. Since they draw mana from the earth, they're great tools for efficient spellcasting.
This is probably a good lead. I can determine the size of the dragon, along with other details, from the placement of the rune stones alone.
I'm going to analyze the mana that's lingering over here. Would you mind taking a look at the rune stones for me?
Go on. How were they arranged?
I see. Based on what you're telling me, the dragon should be the right size for Madria's pet.
I sense that a spell of spatial distortion was cast here recently. If I had to guess, some sort of cloaking magic...

If the dragon had used lumarigon mana to power such a spell, it would have been like sending out a signal flare to magic users like me. It must have used rune magic so that it could have a dip in the hot springs without any interruptions...
That lucky lizard. I wish I had time to laze around in hot water all day!
Anyway, our prey was careless to just leave these rune stones here. It probably didn't expect to be hunted by a wizard of my caliber.
I can use what we found here to focus my tracking spell a little more. Hopefully we can get a more precise location this time...
Success! The spell is more accurate than before, thanks to my brilliant deductions.
There's a lava floe deep in Magma Gorge. The lumarigon was there recently.
That's as far as my spell was able to trace. With any luck, we'll find some more clues that will help me refine the spell even more.

Do you have any idea how exhausting teleportation magic is? The drain on my spirit more than doubles with each extra person I take with me!
If you're ever dating a mage and you want to break up with them, all you have to do is say "Teleport me over to my place." They'll dump you before you can blink!
Magma Gorge isn't too far. Think of this as a chance to see the sights. I need to save my own energies for tracking magic, after all.
Magma Gorge isn't too far. Think of this as a chance to see the sights. I need to save my own energies for tracking magic, after all.
Phew. So glad I didn't walk here. Who knew magma was so hot?
Anyway, this place is full of interesting clues.
See the dragon scales scattered all over? They tell an interesting story.
Dragon skin is like steel. When it's injured, the dragon will go into hot fire or lava to burn its wounds cut. It's like how a blacksmith melts a dull blade in the forge in order to fix it.
Old scales will fall off the dragon's body in the process. Of course, examining these scales will tell us lots about the dragon.
I need you to get up close and personal with those scales. Tell me everything you can about them. No detail is unimportant, no matter how small!
I'd love to take a look at the scales myself, but I'm allergic to scalding hot lava.
Too hot... Oh, are you done?
I felt dark magic on the scales.
Really? Quick, show me your hand.
Yes, yes. Traces of shadow magic still cling to you. These definitely came from the scales...
Incredible. Traditionally, dark magic and dragons don't exactly mix.
There's no doubt about it. The dragon we're tracking is Madria's dragon.
It's amazing enough that we found a living lumarigon—or something like a lumarigon. But for that same creature to be tainted by dark magic? It's all a little too much.
Anyway, I need to refocus my spell.
Give me a minute. With any luck, I'll be able to find out where the dragon was heading...
Hmm... I think I'm picking up the source of this dark energy.
A unique signature. Shadow magic mixed with lumarigon mana. It's coming from the Land of Darkness...
But I can't pinpoint the location from here. We need to go to the $map:02000146$. I should be able to do a more precise scan from there.
All right, $MyPCName$. I'll see you the—
You don't expect me to walk again, do you?
(Turn the puppy dog eyes up to 11.)
Okay, enough! Hold on tight. And if I collapse from exhaustion, this is your fault, got it?
Okay, enough! Hold on tight. And if I collapse from exhaustion, this is your fault, got it?
Ugh... Group teleportation is really hard! You cheated by looking so pitiful and sad!
Well... I've learned a lot by going out into the field with you. So I guess we can consider ourselves even.
Anyway, I can sense the lumarigon's magic clearly now, this close to the Land of Darkness.
I see Obsidian Mount... No, beyond... Is that a forest?
Tch... What a hassle. It seems Madria's dragon has some business in Blackmist Forest.
The dark energy of that forest erodes other magical signals. Madria's dragon was probably topping off its own energy reserves...
Dragons can gather mana from the air just by breathing, you know. It's just one of many quirks of the draconic respiratory system!
Wait, this isn't the time for dragon facts. The forest and its denizens are gluttons for magic.
We have to hurry, or there will be no traces of lumarigon magic left for us to analyze!
I'll go. The Land of Darkness is too dangerous for you.
Not so fast! I am a master wizard, you know!
Sure. You try maintaining all these spells for hours at a time and see how bright and chipper you are. Of course I'm tired!
Fine, you win. I'll rest here for a bit. When you've done in the forest, meet me back here.
Is there anything I should look for in particular?
For now? Just get rid of the monsters there. Their dark magic should glop onto you. It'll be simple for me to scoop off some samples when you're done.
Blackmist Forest is somewhere beyond Obsidian Mount in the Land of Darkness. The path may be hard to find, so keep your eyes open.
All right. Let's take a look!
<font color="#909090">(Orde leans in and looks you all over.)</font>

What...? Right under our noses this whole time...?
Thanks to the latest sample you brought me, I can pinpoint the location of the lumarigon magic perfectly now.

I'm going on ahead. I need to check on something first. See you there!
I'm going on ahead. I need to check on something first. See you there!

This is really amazing... How hasn't the alliance noticed this place? It's right here!
We've been swimming in lumarigon magic lately.
Hmm... That's a good point. That energy could be the key that unlocked this place for us.
The time for investigation is over. Now we see what's beyond this phase distortion with our own eyes.
A spell this massive... Even if all the mages in the empire got together, they couldn't dispel it.
I guess that's obvious. Human magic doesn't hold a candle to dragon magic, after all.
I'm concerned by the shifts in the distortion that I'm picking up. By this time tomorrow, we may lose our ability to even see this much.
If we wait for the alliance to send reinforcements, it'll be too late. We have to break through this spell ourselves.
You said all the mages in the empire couldn't do that.
I was talking about them, not me! Anyway, we were the ones to find this place, right? I'm sure we can figure it out.
Instead of punching through the cloak directly, we're going to make the spell break down on its own. Mana overload.
When the mana flow reaches a pressure too high for the spell matrix to handle, the whole thing will overload. Then, poof, no more spell.
We just need to keep feeding it more phase magic.
First, let's seal up the spell's outflows. I can sense a stream of dark energy coming from the gorge to the right.
Gather materials from that place for the seal. I'll prepare things on my end while you're doing that.
Go to the gorge to our right. Collect anything that seems like a good source of dark energy.
This should be more than enough. Great!
Hm. This energy is in powder form, and the material is too dry. In a ritual chamber, it would be perfect, but it'll blow away out in the open like this.
I need a secondary source of dark energy that I can use as a mortar.
I saw some dark essences floating around the nearby fields.
You and your astute observations! I hadn't noticed that.
Dark energy that's practically alive... This place is sick with darkness. Fortunately for us, we actually need dark energy at the moment.
We're almost there. Help me out a little more!

Please rune stones on each of the six seal points while I put the finishing touches on the spell.

All right. Okay. Let's get them nice and distracted. Then, when we get a chance, we can call for reinforcements from the alliance!

We'll handle things here. Make sure Dark Wind is holding its own.

$npcName:11000042[gender:1]$, can you interpret the runes engraved on the gate? I don't want any surprises.

Well, you have spent quite a bit of time indoors lately. Perhaps a little field trip is in order?
With the empress's grand court coming up, caravans are coming from throughout the land to bring in all manner of delicacies and goods.
As a royal mage, you do have a responsibility to the safety of the empire and its people. Perhaps you could lend a hand to one of these caravans.
Ah, but I've just remembered. You hate field trips, don't you? Yes, that's right. Back to reading, I suppose...
I believe this field trip will be important to the development of my moral character.
You've found your motivation, have you? Very well. I shall make the arrangements.
The next caravan should be leaving from $map:02000062$. Speak with the guard when you get there.
Have fun. But do remember that this is supposed to be educational, will you?
The caravan is waiting in $map:02000062$. Talk to the guard there.
Hey there! You must be Anne's student.
It is time to strike the heart of Madrakan and attack the phase control network. I want you to lead the charge, $MyPCName$.
It is time to strike the heart of Madrakan and attack the phase control network. I want you to lead the charge, $MyPCName$.
Well done! Your tactics are an inspiration.
It is time for the final assault on Madrakan. We must put an end to Madria's evil.
This won't be an easy battle. Prepare yourself.
The mission is simple. Attack Madrakan's rampart, central base, and spire. I'm counting on you to lead us to victory.
We've defeated Tria's sworn enemy, Madria!
Look! It's the Maple Alliance's vanguard, $MyPCName$!
Three cheers for the Maple Alliance! Three cheers for $MyPCName$!
$male:He,female:She$ looked at me! $MyPCName$ looked at me!!
Truly, that was an amazing victory. The troops are in high spirits. I can't remember the last time we were able to celebrate...
Thanks to your efforts, the Madrakan mission has been a complete success.
It seems you've become a hero that could lead us all. You've earned my respect, $MyPCName$.
How's it looking, Boss? Are we getting a steady power feed?
So far, so good. The streetlights, the clock in the town square... Everything is operating properly!
This is the power of the fusion core! This incredible generator alone is more than enough to power Edelstein.
With this, we can give the town an endless supply of energy.
Usually you'd need magic to get that much energy.
Those days are in the past!
Aisha, let's head to the lab and do one last check on the fusion core.
Come on, let's go to the lab!
We're ready for the final test!
Good work. $npcName:11003291[gender:1]$, your skills have grown.
It's 'cause you're a great teacher, Boss!
I really am, aren't I? $npcName:11003291[gender:1]$, you just might be a genius for recognizing my genius.
If you think that, then I must be the smartest lady alive!
I'm ready when you are, Boss!
Good, good. Let's check the core temperature, then move on to the next phase.
Wow, Boss! You look so awesome fighting that fire!
Wow, Boss! You looked so awesome fighting that fire!
You're not just a crack shot with your Extinguisher cannon—you're amazing with a normal extinguisher, too!
Sometimes I wish I wasn't so amazing at everything...
Now, where were we? Oh, right. The core temperature!
Standing by to check thermometer, Boss!
Even without the fire, the core is way too hot!
There's got to be a way... Something to cool down the core...
Water slime! I need water slime!
Aisha, open the sewer hatch! We'll harvest the water slimes for their goop, then use it to cool the core!
I'll get the slime blobs. You get ready to slather the core with them!
B-Boss! How are the slime blobs coming?
The core temperature is stabilizing. I can tell just by looking at it. It scares me how good I am at this...
I've done it again. I'm such a genius.
$npcName:11003291[gender:1]$, you flatterer. But you're not wrong!
Give me a minute! I'm analyzing.
Yep, just as I thought. We blew out every last fuse.
Then we just have to replace the fuses and reboot the terminal. Right, Boss?
You've learned well, $npcName:11003291[gender:1]$. I'll leave it to—
Boss! Show me how it's done!
I hope you took notes. Next time, you're doing the repairs. You are supposed to be my assistant, after all.
But Boss, if I learn how to do everything... Won't I have to leave you and start a workshop of my own?
Aisha, Aisha, Aisha. People meet and part ways all the time. That's just life. No matter how much you adore me, I can't keep you by my side forever.
You're right, Boss. When you say it that way...
It wouldn't hurt you to feel a little sad, would it...?
$npcName:11003183[gender:0]$! You've got a lot of nerve, showing your face here.
Is that how you're going to greet your best friend? How cold.
Our friendship ended the moment you tried to make Edelstein the base for your stupid rebellion!
But it's okay for you to use it as your base? Not cool.
And our rebellion is not stupid! We're the Resistance, and we're fighting the forces of magic!
I don't want to hear it. What are you doing here?
Straight to business, then. Since we're old friends, I'm here to borrow something.
What do you call it... a fusion core? A promising design, even if it is just a prototype.
We have a weapon that needs your fusion core to power it. The ultimate weapon to bring Tria to heel...
Hand over the fusion core, and no blood need be shed in Edelstein. What do you say?
My invention is not a weapon! It is the technology that will uplift anyone who doesn't have magic!
You think science is a club you can use to beat down people you don't agree with. Our goals are completely different!
No need to dirty our own hands, is there? Send in the droids.
Droids, initialize protocol Savage Beating Alpha.
Trust me, you don't want to see Savage Beating Beta.
Since when do you guys have this kind of tech...?
I already know who they are, Boss. I saw the picture on your workshop table.
Now they're common villains trying to use my inventions for evil.
$npcName:11003291[gender:1]$, we have no choice. Prepare the HAPPY protocol.
We can't let these jokers have my invention, no matter what. Can I count on you?
I'll do whatever you ask of me. Just say the word!
HAPPY protocol countdown begins now. Let's get out of here!

Whatever it is, it's not as important as your life! Hurry up, Boss!
$MyPCName$! What is the meaning of this?!
Ah, Mayor! As you can see, my fusion core encountered a... small bug...
Nothing to be worried about. Won't happen again. Promise.
<font size='20'>Pst! Boss! Why didn't you tell him about your friends...?</font>
<font size='20'>Shh! We need to handle this delicately.</font>
<font size='20'>To be loyal in a situation like this... Boss, you're so great!</font>
<font size='20'>Even if you offered a million gold, I'm no snitch!</font>
You've gone too far this time, $MyPCName$. As the mayor of $map:52000107$, I can't allow it.
I expect you to pay 1.5 billion for the damages to the town. Then I expect you to leave and never return.

You've gone too far this time, $MyPCName$. As the mayor of $map:52000107$, I can't allow it.
Indeed. I will pay the 1.5 billion mesos needed to repair Edelstein.

We did it, Boss! We're gonna be okay! Thank you, Mr. $npcName:11000264[gender:0]$!

Let us find somewhere more quiet to talk.
Let us find somewhere more quiet to talk.

If it were anyone else, I'd assume they'd want an autograph. But you, $npcName:11000264[gender:0]$... There could be only one reason for you to swoop in and save me like this.
You want to be my apprentice, right? I already have one, but there's always room for one more, I say!
...I have no interest in working with you.
I've come to collect your little energy reactor.

You've got me! $MyPCName$, genius inventor... at your service.

Look. I'd love to give them to you. Really, I would. But...
All of my notes were destroyed in the blast.
<font color="#909090">(You knew you were forgetting something...)</font>
How tiresome. It seems you are my only hope to recreate the fusion core.
Very well. From now on, you're mine.
Oh! A shiver just ran down my spine. Is this how it feels to be an item...?
What do you expect? I've already paid my 1.5 billion mesos, and I don't intend to return empty-handed.
You will recreate your work on the fusion core. In the meantime, I can find some other uses for you...
Boss... Are we gonna be okay...?

<font color="#909090">(And here is Ladin's first task. You are to escort a caravan to Tria in preparation for the empress's open court.)</font>
<font color="#909090">(How dare he work you like a slave? And what does this have to do with recreating the fusion core?)</font>

All right? How could I be all right? My family... friends... the fusion core... all gone, all gone!
I'm sorry to hear that, $male:sir,female:ma'am$. Now, if you're here to guard the caravan, you'd better get inside.

All right, all right! I'm going!
And apparently, distracted. Did something happen?
Our target is Dark Wind, Kerning City's spy ring.
That explains why we're here. They have a hidden base in this club.
Yes. And because of some intel from Ru—I mean, my informant in Dark Wind.
It seems they have some kind of special mission in the works. We're going to find out what they're up to.
These orders came from the $npcName:11001815[gender:0]$ himself.
That means that the $npcName:11001811[gender:0]$ will be taking a direct and personal interest in our results. Don't fail him!
This is your operation, $MyPCName$. Give your orders.

<font color="#909090">(But that's unimportant for now. Focus on the mission.)</font>

Speak up, or you'll regret it!
Do you see now, $MyPCName$? There's no point in talking to these dogs. If I didn't know better, I'd say you've gone soft...

Answer my questions and no one gets hurt.

Now, it's time to fulfill your end of the bargain.

We've got it all written down. Check the stacks of notes over there.

You don't think this is the first time we've had this conversation, do you?

Normally we'd have disposed of you the first time it happened. But you have a special gift for killing, so we simply wiped your mind... and tried again.
It's a shame. You could have gone far. But your reckless behavior has interfered with the Black Mage's plans too many times.
It is time you were retired... permanently.
I'm sorry it has to come to this, $MyPCName$.
I didn't think I'd be swimming through the sewers when I woke up this morning...
They brainwashed you good, didn't they? I knew you weren't like the other Rooks.

An assassin who refuses to kill. You really are something else.
Even if the Rooks wipe your memories, they can't take away who you are deep down inside.

Why don't you join us? Dark Wind can help find out who you really are.

You feeling okay, $male:mister,female:miss$? You look a bit red.
<font color="#909090">(You can't remember the last time you spoke with a person who wasn't an assassin or spy.)</font>

You really do need to learn how to do something other than scream and rage. We need to work on making you a real civilized person!
That's really too bad. I guess I have no choice...
...but to tell grandpa not to give you any more meat for a week.
You wouldn't dare! What kind of monster holds meat hostage?!
All you have to do is learn how to calm your inner self.

Pick some Riena Flowers and make me a beautiful bouquet.
Tch... This is extortion, you know!
Pick some Riena Flowers and make me a beautiful bouquet.
Huh... This is actually pretty fun...
If I just close my eyes and pretend these flowers are the old man... Heheheh...

I only had one flower to go!
I only had one flower to go!
Are you showing the big bad flowers who's boss?
Honestly, you'll never be fit to leave the island at this rate...
I don't care! I don't have to leave the island! I'll just live here forever!!

I'm disappointed in you, $MyPCName$. I thought you were more mature than this. However, I see that you're still just a baby, after all.
Baby? Baby? Could a baby use a huge honkin' sword like this?!
Hahaha! It seems I need to keep a closer eye on you two.
Hahaha! It seems I need to keep a closer eye on you two.
Lilin. $MyPCName$. Let's have a quick talk.

Well, there is a god of rage sealed inside of $MyPCName$'s body. I thought it would be a good idea to help $male:him,female:her$ rein it in a little.
But $male:he,female:she$ doesn't seem to care at all! Sometimes, I think $male:he,female:she$ wants to let the rage take over.
Hey, I didn't ask to be this way! Why do I have to deal with your nonsense because of something some dusty old ancestors did?!
I was born this way, okay? I can't help it!
You don't have to shout! You'll burst your seal.
That is quite the plan you've come up with, Lilin.
And $MyPCName$, why do you want to beat me so badly?
I already said why! I want to be the strongest warrior in the world. I don't care about gods or seals or any of that other junk.
You're supposed to be the strongest man alive. So if I beat you, then I'll be the strongest.
Stop looking down your nose at me! We're the same age, so you don't get to be all high and mighty!
If we're the same age, then why don't you act like it?
All right, all right. That's enough, you two. I do believe you'll reach your goals much more quickly if you just work together.
Come with me, both of you. We'll meet at the red greatsword in front of the training yard.
I have much to tell you.
Come with me, both of you. We'll meet at the red greatsword in front of the training yard.
You've probably gotten so used to this greatsword that you don't even notice it anymore. But starting today, that's going to change.
Lilin, this greatsword is what $MyPCName$ needs if $male:he,female:she$ is going to seal away the god of rage for good.
This was that god's weapon. If you can control this blade, then you can control the god that wielded it.
$MyPCName$, that is why you need to trust Lilin. To master the weapon, you must master your own rage.
If you can't do that, then the day you take up this greatsword... is the day that disaster falls upon us all.
Just as it did long ago, when the demon god Maha awoke on Rien Island.
Soooo... if I can master this weapon, I won't just be stronger than you. I'll be stronger than a god?
That isn't a bad angle. And then I could claim to have trained the world's greatest fighter...
I hope you two are taking this seriously!
$MyPCName$, there's no need for you to leave the island. I'll train you personally. But, in exchange, you need to work with Lilin to get your rage under control.

I've never heard you speak so politely before! It's creeping me out.
See? You're already influencing $male:him,female:her$ for the better.
Follow me, $MyPCName$. We'll begin your real training right away.
What are we doing in this old place? I'm sick of fighting bamboo dummies.

Spare me the history lessons. Let's do this!
Ha! I can see Lilin's going to have her hands full with you.
Very well. I'm going to call the monsters now. Show me what you can do with that oversized blade of yours!
Very well. I'm going to call the monsters now. Show me what you can do with that oversized blade of yours!
You did well, for a novice.
So... this is what fighting monsters feels like...
It's... fun! I want to fight more!
More! Give me more monsters to beat up!
Now you've got a taste for battle. All right. Prepare yourself.
Show me what you can really do!
That was pretty tough... But it was fun!
<font color="#909090">(He turns away and mutters to himself.)</font> A born warrior, in love with the rush of battle.
But... if you do not fear death, then you will not cherish life. You will be no better than the god of rage...
A fear of death... can be learned.
What next, old man? I'm not done!
Wow! This is the first time you were the one to challenge me.
The battles you've fought until now have been safe, controlled. That isn't the case when you're out in the real world.
How a warrior fights in the training yard is different from how he fights on the battlefield. I think it's time that you learned this difference.
Big talk, old man. Now that I'm warmed up, I'll beat you for sure!
How a warrior fights in the training yard is different from how he fights on the battlefield. I think it's time that you learned this difference.
Are you okay, $MyPCName$? You look pale.
He used all his usual moves, but that aura...
He's been taking it easy on me this whole time...
Well, that's it for the 999th match. You have a long way to go before you're ready for the 1,000th.
Remember what you've learned here. Without a reverence for death, you will be sloppy. A sword should not be swung lightly.

I told them I didn't want to hear from them again... All right, let's see it.
The Door of Light... Could it be...?
I wonder how grandpa is doing. He hasn't sent us so much as a letter, and it's been days...
Hmph! I think it's awfully convenient that this happened right after he finally agreed to train me.
It's not that bad! Think of this as a chance to work on your emotional training.
I'm worried... Did you see the old man's face? For something to scare him, of all people...
Well, I'm not going to stop training just because he's not here. I want to get my hands on the red sword as soon as I can!
Sure, sure. Start by hitting the training dummy 800 times.
Sorry to break it to you, but fighting dummies doesn't cut it anymore!
Hold on. Do you feel that?
This is no time to talk! We have to fight those... things!
Whew. Those shadow creatures were something else...
Hey, I looked pretty good just now, didn't I?
What's up with you? We survived, didn't we?
It came from one of those... things.
Take a look at this. It came from one of those... things.

D-don't be stupid! The old man could eat those chumps for breakfast!

Ugh! Why are you even letting yourself think such stupid thoughts?
Thank you. I feel better now.
Uh... you feeling okay? I don't think I've ever heard you thank me for anything before.

We may not be related by blood, but I grew up with you on this stupid hunk of ice.

I'm going to find the old man. I'm not done with him yet.
And I might learn a thing or two while I'm at it. You're the one who's always saying I should go out and see the world.
Remember, I'm the one who's going to beat the old man. So don't worry about us. Just keep Rien safe.
I'm not sure why, but that's... reassuring.
You thanked me! Again! Did one of those monsters knock you on the head?
Just try not to get hurt too badly. I'll be waiting for you and grandpa.
<font color="#909090">(The locals said the caravan to $map:02000001$ leaves from here. That's where the old man's letter came from, so it's a good place to start looking for him.)</font>
<font color="#909090">(As much as you hate getting involved in other people's messes, at least if you take the caravan to the capital, you won't have to worry about getting lost.)</font>
<font color="#909090">(Why is everyone in such a big hurry to get to Tria, anyway?)</font>
Hello! You look like an adventurer. We happen to be looking to hire caravan guards, if you're interested.

I am the warrior destined to surpass both demons and gods!
<font color="#909090">(He didn't even bat an eyelash... Who is this man?!)</font>
<font color="#909090">(You don't have time for this. You'll defeat him... after you return from Tria.)</font>
